post_text:
JATC North Aircraft Pilot Class Takes Flight as Part of Delta Airlines ‘Girls in Aviation Day’

It was a ond-day trip of a lifetime for some students enrolled in the Aircraft Pilot program at JATC North. They were invited by Delta Airlines to participate in ‘Girls in Aviation Day.’ It was a day designed to get more females interested in becoming airline pilots. Aircraft Pilot teacher, Fiona Silcox said nine girls in her class were treated to an all expenses paid flight to Houston, Texas for a day of fun and experiencing what it is like to be a pilot and to work in the aviation industry. The Delta 737 plane making the trip had an all female flight crew with about 100 girls on board from around the State of Utah. Once they landed in Houston, the students were treated to a tour of the Johnson Space Center, the Space Center Museum and NASA Space Mission Control Center. They also had the opportunity to meet and talk to a female astronaut.

We wish these young ladies the best as they pursue their future careers.
#jordanschooldistrict #jordandistrict #uted #utpol

post_text:
Holocaust Survivor Brings Powerful Message to Middle School Students

Elk Ridge Middle School students heard from Holocaust survivor Ruth Kapp Hartz, who is the subject of the book titled "Your Name is Renée." Ruth hopes that talking about her experiences of surviving in Nazi-controlled Europe as a child will help others fight intolerance and give a voice to those that feel marginalized. She says that the students of today will become the voices of tomorrow to keep the history and lessons learned from the Holocaust alive.

Thank you, Ruth, for sharing your powerful message with students.

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation

Students at Columbia Elementary School are always thinking of ways to tell Principal Abe Yospe how important he is in making Columbia a great place to be and to learn. post_text:
FUN FACT FRIDAY: South Jordan Elementary School Students Invited to Sing at Utah Jazz Game

It is not everyday you get to perform before a crowd of 18,000 people at an NBA game – but that is exactly what a group of South Jordan Elementary School students will soon be doing.

The 4th, 5th and 6th graders have been invited to perform the National Anthem at the Utah Jazz Game at Vivint Smart Home Arena. The students, under the musical direction of teacher Scott Knight, will perform the National Anthem a capella. It is a performance that will honor America and the men and women who serve or have served our country.

The performance is on Wednesday, October 16 – the Jazz take on the Portland Trail Blazers.

We are very proud of these students and their hard work. We wish them the very best of luck at the Jazz game!

Watch this video of their recent rehearsal.

#JordanDistrict #JordanSchoolDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation Utah Jazz City of South Jordan

post_text:
Herriman Elementary School Student Designs Logo for Herriman City Police

It is not every day that a fifth grade student designs something that will be seen throughout her city on a daily basis – but that is exactly what Herriman Elementary School’s Avery Evans did. Last year Avery entered a contest sponsored by the Herriman City Police Department. Students were asked to submit designs for the department’s new DARE jeep.

There were about 1,000 entries submitted and Avery’s design was selected as the winner and it is now on the side of the new DARE jeep for all to see.

Officer Jake Cutright, along with other Herriman City officials, came to school to surprise and congratulate Avery on her achievement.

What a wonderful opportunity for a very talented young student.

Way to go, Avery!

#jordanschooldistrict #jordandistrict #uted #utpol Herriman City Herriman City Police Department

Teachers Get Pies in Their Faces, Drenched in Silly String and Slime After Students Achieve Fundraising Goal

Students at Oakcrest Elementary School celebrated in a silly way after achieving a fundraising goal that will support teachers and students in and outside the classroom. After raising $16,000 for things like classroom supplies and student activities, the school held an assembly where teachers and the assistant principal made good on a promise they made. They agreed to have pies in their faces, silly string sprayed all over them and Assistant Principal Kristie Howe agreed to be drenched in blue slime if the students reached the fundraising goal.

Congratulations to the students for working so hard on behalf of their amazing school!

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation West Jordan City Hall Oakcrest Elementary School

post_text:
Former Student Gives Back to Fox Hollow Elementary School

When Thatcher Mathews recently embarked on an Eagle Scout project, he decided it would be something to benefit his favorite elementary school – Fox Hollow Elementary. So Thatcher, who is now a 9th grade student at Sunset Ridge Middle, worked with the Fox Hollow administration, custodian, PE assistants and a local vinyl company to design a “Sensory Path or Walk.” The “Sensory Walk” was installed on the floor in two different entrances to the gym. The walk is a way for students to warm up before gym class by following a path, which includes tasks like hopping, balancing, bending and touching. So far the “Sensory Walk” is a big hit at the school. Thanks to Thatcher Mathews for giving back to a school he loves.
#jordanschooldistrict #jordandistrict #uted #utpol

post_text:
Students Learn From Real-Life Crime Scene Investigation "CSI" Professionals

Students from Bingham High School's 'Medical Forensics' science class received some hands-on training from the South Jordan Police Department. Students learned from professional crime scene investigators how to identify clues using police techniques; they also processed evidence in the same manner as law enforcement would. This field trip is one of several hands-on events that students in the medical forensics course will have with law enforcement this year.

Thank you to South Jordan Police Department for taking time out of your busy day to teach students about the forensics side of the criminal justice system.

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation

post_text:
FUN FACT FRIDAY: Students Offer Hair Cuts and Nail Services at Low Cost

If you are looking for an affordable haircut, manicure, pedicure or acrylic nails done, we have students excited to provide the services. They are all enrolled and training in the JATC South Barbering, Hair Design and Nail Tech courses.

The students offer a variety of haircuts and styles along with nail services as part of their course work.

Barbering, Hair Design and Nail Tech students will be taking clients on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 8 a.m. and 11:30 a.m. starting in November. Appointments are made depending on availability and process.

Call 801-412-1311 for a hair appointment.
Call 801-412-1325 or 801-412-1316 for a nail appointment.

Here are a few examples of the student costs:

• Manicure or pedicure with polish - $6
• Acrylic Nails - $16 – Colored Acrylics - $5 per color
• Haircut and style - $5
• Updo - $8
• Highlights or foiling - $25+
• Beard Trim - $2

#jordanschooldistrict #jordandistrict #uted #utpol

post_text:
WELLNESS WEDNESDAY: Free Social & Emotional Wellness Screening for Students

Every person faces social and emotional difficulties throughout the course of their life. There are always ups and downs - we all experience them.

Though struggle is normal, sometimes it may be more than that and parents often wonder when it might be time to get their child help.

On October 9th, Jordan School District will be hosting a Social and Emotional Wellness Screening at Heartland Elementary School. This event is open to all JSD community members. It is an opportunity to have some of your questions answered regarding what your child may be struggling with and what you can do to help them.

We hope to see you and your family there! Please refer to the flyer for details and information on how to sign up.

#jordanschooldistrict #jordandistrict #uted #utpol

Jonathan Lawes is an amazing math teacher at Elk Ridge Middle School who is not only good at equations – he has developed a talent for teaching using video production. It’s all a unique effort to help students achieve at the very highest levels.

Mr. Lawes work is supported by a Jordan School District Board of Education educator grant.

post_text:
West Jordan Middle School's Kindness is Olympic Sized

As a part of West Jordan Middle Schools "Kombat with Kindness" week, Student Ambassadors held the "Kindness Olympics" during the schools two lunch hours. With games like "Family Feud, the Kindness Edition" and "Pop Your Way to Kindness," the student leaders set out to engage their peers and leave a positive impact on the school. The goal of "Kombat with Kindness" is to be an inclusive movement that brings hope and respect to everyone.

Great job WJMS students and staff for creating fun and engaging events. Keep up the great work!

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation #LionPride West Jordan Middle School

post_text:
Clark Planetarium Makes a Science Stop at Fox Hollow Elementary

Students in the 6th grade at Fox Hollow Elementary School were treated to a Clark Planetarium class without even leaving the building. That’s because experts from the Planetarium came to Fox Hollow where they met with the entire 6th grade and then individual classes conducting demonstrations and teaching science concepts. The lessons included demonstrations on moon phases and eclipses, gravity and inertia along with lesson on air pressure.

Students enjoyed the opportunity and we appreciate the Clark Planetarium’s outreach to keep kids excited about science.
#jordandistrict #jordanschooldistrict #uted #utpol

post_text:
Chinese Dual Language Immersion Students Reach Out to Victims of Tour Bus Crash in Southern Utah

It is a simple act of kindness that students in Jordan School District’s Chinese Dual Language Immersion classes hope will make a difference in the lives of Chinese tourists going through a tragic time right now. The students decided to write individual notes of love and support in home-made get well cards to the Chinese men and women who were involved in the tour bus crash near Bryce Canyon on Friday. The cards were written in Chinese and English.

Hundreds of cards will be hand-delivered to crash survivors who are still hospitalized. The students from Eastlake, Foothills, Southland and Monte Vista Elementary Schools hope the gesture will give the Chinese men and women some comfort, knowing children in Utah care about them and their road to recovery.

#JordanDistrict #JordanSchoolDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation

SUPERCAST Episode 3: The Happiness Forecast - Getting the Forecast Right Can Bring More Sunshine Into Your Child’s Life

How can parents help manage the fear and uncertainty that comes with a new school year, new environments and new friendships?

Superintendent Anthony Godfrey sits down with JSD Health and Wellness Specialist McKinley Withers to talk about managing change in our child’s life and offers some ways to help overcome the social health crisis we are seeing in students today.

Episode Info & Show Notes for Episode 3: The Happiness Forecast

Previous episodes can be found at supercast.jordandistrict.org

post_text:
Jordan Parent University

We want to thank the hundreds of parents and students who attended Thursday night’s Jordan Parent University. The topic was “Preparing Parents and Students for the Future After High School.” College, University, Community College, Military representatives and counselors were all on hand to offer guidance and advice in planning for the future after high school.

Thanks to everyone who attended, we hope this was a helpful and informative event!

The next Jordan Parent University is on Thursday, November 21 at Mountain Creek Middle School in South Jordan from 7 – 8:30 p.m. The topic is “Who Should Parents Call When Issues Arise?”

Jordan Parent University is free and open to the public.
#jordanschooldistrict #jordandistrict #uted #utpol

post_text:
Jordan Education Foundation Thankful for Community Kindness

Every day the Jordan Education Foundation (JEF) works hard to provide for the needs of students throughout Jordan School District - but they couldn’t do it without an outpouring of community kindness and support.

For example, over the past few days kind and caring individuals simply stopped by the JEF office to drop off food and other items to support students in need in our schools.

Natalie Smiley, a student at Copper Hills High School, donated 125 pairs of brand new shoes and some backpacks thanks to local businesses and her DECA class who joined in the effort to help students in need.

Another special surprise came from the Country Park 4th Ward Relief Society in South Jordan. These generous ladies opened their hearts to students in need by putting 250 weekend food packs together along with collecting food items for Principal’s Pantries throughout the District.

Thank you for making a difference in the lives of children and teens every day!

#jordanschooldistrict #jordandistrict #uted #utpol

post_text:
Students Get a Hands-On Farm Experience During 7th-Grade Agriculture Day

Students pet a horse with it's handler looking on. 7th-grade students from across Jordan School District are spending two days learning about agriculture, and its impacts on their lives. The annual two-day event brings specialists from different agricultural organizations together with business to provide a hands-on educational experience. Students learned about different professions in the ag industry as well as how food makes its way from farms to the dinner table. Utah growers brought fruit and vegetables for the 7th-graders to sample and a local horse therapy organization taught the students about the different way animals interact with people.

Thank you to all who donated their time and supplies to make this year’s Agriculture Day a success.

#JordanDistrict #JordanSchoolDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation

post_text:
Riverton High School Helps Disney Pilot Two New Plays

The theater department at Riverton High School is bringing two new Disney worlds to life with the pilot productions of " Squirrel Girl Goes to College" and "Subatomic a Stature Play." Last spring, Disney contacted Mr. Eaton and Ms. McGuire in the school's Performing Arts Department about bringing two "secret" Marvel Comics projects to the stage. The challenge for staff was that they did not receive details about the productions or scripts until August 1st. After the performances, the high school's theater department will report back to Disney and Marvel about the student's experiences and how the audience reacted to the plays.

You can catch " Squirrel Girl Goes to College" and "Subatomic a Stature Play" on Friday, September 13th at 7:00 pm and Monday, September 15th at 7:00 pm at the Riverton High School Auditorium.

#JordanDistrict #JordanSchoolDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation Riverton City Government

Mountain Point Elementary Celebrates the Unveiling of Their School Colors and Mascot

The new Mountain Point Elementary School in Bluffdale unveiled their school mascot and colors during a fun school-wide celebration. Dynasty Athletics dance group helped students open large wrapped boxes filled with balloons that revealed the new school colors of light blue, black and white. The new mascot, a puma, showed off the school's new t-shirts that were donated by Hughes General Contractors. At the end of the assembly, each student was able to take home a T-shirt and other school swag.

Thank you to everyone who made today's unveiling a success.

#JordanDistrict #JordanSchoolDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation Bluffdale City, Utah Mountain Point Elementary

post_text:
Middle School Students Pay Tribute with "Sunrise Salute" on Patriot Day

Students and staff at South Jordan Middle School honored the memories of everyone impacted by the September 11th, 2001 terrorist attacks with a morning "Sunrise Salute." The program featured Mr. Kidd's Choir students singing patriotic songs with over a dozen local first responders in attendance. The salute also featured thoughts and memories from staff on this day 18 years ago.

Thank you, South Jordan Middle School, for showing gratitude to those who serve and protect us every day.

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation South Jordan Police Department South Jordan City Fire Department City of South Jordan

post_text:
South Jordan City Mayor Visits JSD Schools for Upcoming Episode of ‘City Jobs with the Mayor’

South Jordan Mayor, Dawn Ramsey, recently took the time to visit South Jordan Elementary School and Bingham High School for something called City Jobs with the Mayor. It is a video series where the Mayor gets to know and participate in various jobs throughout her city. This upcoming segment will show how South Jordan City helps keep children safe throughout the school year. The video will focus on crossing guards, school resource and D.A.R.E. officers.

We appreciate communities like South Jordan working with Jordan School District to keep our students safe.

Thanks for stopping by Mayor Ramsey! We look forward to seeing the school safety episode of City Jobs with the Mayor.

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation City of South Jordan

post_text:
School Cafeteria Transformed into ‘State Fair’ Stop for Students

Students at Daybreak Elementary School were treated to a true taste of the Utah State Fair as they headed to the school cafeteria on Wednesday. Lunch ladies created a State Fair-like atmosphere wearing colorful clothing, making cow cookies, serving corn dogs, hamburgers, cow sunglasses and offering prizes in a coloring contest. While the students loved the food, the dancing cow was a really big hit.

It was State Fair Day in the cafeteria and each student who ate school lunch received a ticket to the Utah State Fair. It’s an opportunity for children who might otherwise miss out on the activities, exhibits and experience of going to the fair.

Thank you to our amazing lunch ladies and Dairy West for making mealtime such a memorable “State Fair” experience!

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrit #utah #utpol #UtahEducation

post_text:
FUN FACT FRIDAY: More New Schools on the Way as Growth Continues

With the opening of five new schools on time and under budget for the 2019-20 school year, construction work doesn’t end.

As rapid growth continues in the District, two additional schools are set to open for the 2020-21 school year.

Construction is underway on a new elementary school in West Jordan at 8860 S. 6400 West. Masons are busy laying brick and they are hoping to have walls up before the winter season sets in. Site work continues at the new school as well. This elementary will be the same design as the new Ridge View and Mountain Point Elementary Schools.

The new Hidden Valley Middle School in Bluffdale is taking shape. The walls are up and windows in and they hope to have a roof in place before winter. This school is the same design as the new West Jordan Middle School.

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation

Hayden Peak Elementary School kindergarten teacher Juli Newman received a check from 1st Class Comfort Heating and Air to buy tools and supplies for her classroom. Ms. Newman received the $350 check because of her dedication to making sure all of her students, even those who struggle academically receive the best education possible. So, the money will be put to good use!

Keep up the great work, Ms. Newman and congratulations on your award.

post_text:
Columbia Elementary Student Finds Unique Way to Share Her Birthday Gifts With Others

One Columbia Elementary School 6th-grade student decided to do something unique with her birthday money. Tavia, who just turned 11-years-old, heard about the need for food donations to the Columbia Elementary School Principal's Pantry. With her birthday cash, Tavia went grocery shopping and filled a cart full of food which she then delivered to Principal Abram Yospe. This donation will help feed dozens of meals to students who might otherwise go without.

Great job Tavia for showing that giving back to your community is the best gift of all!

#JordanDistrict #JordanSchoolDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation Columbia Elementary Astros - West Jordan Jordan Education Association

post_text:
District Facility Services Team Recognized for Amazing Accomplishment

It was a team effort that required hard work, endless planning and some sleepless nights but Jordan School District Facility Services managed to do what some are calling the impossible. They opened five brand new schools on time and under budget for the 2019-20 school year. And, the new Mountain Ridge High School opened a year earlier than scheduled.

Board of Education President Bryce Dunford called it a “herculean task” saying the Board stands in awe of their accomplishments.

The facilities team was honored with a plaque and the first-ever JSD Golden Hammer Award.

Congratulations to everyone involved for getting the new schools open, supporting students and education.
#jordandistrict #jordanschooldistrict #uted #utpol

post_text:
Oquirrh Hills Middle School Teacher Receives State Recognition

She makes learning fun and her tireless dedication to students is getting teacher Nicole Patty from Oquirrh Hills Middle School State recognition.

Ms. Patty was selected as the teacher spotlight for Heath and Physical Education from the Utah State Board of Education.

The individual who nominated Ms. Patty for the prestigious award said, "She is amazing! She teaches the kids real life information and makes it applicable to their daily lives. She teaches in a fun way and creates assignments where parents and students have to discuss the aspects of what they are talking about in class. She keeps parents apprised of what is being discussed in class so that sensitive topics can be discussed with parents too. She is great!"

Teachers and staff at Oquirrh Hills Middle School are thrilled to see this recognition for such a deserving teacher. They say Ms. Patty is amazing and an absolute asset to OHMS.

Congratulations, Ms. Patty!

#jordanschooldistrict #jordandistrict #uted #utpol Riverton City Government

post_text:
Superintendent Godfrey Visits Classrooms for Conversation with Students

It was a surprise visit that brought smiles and excitement to some students at Terra Linda Elementary School. Superintendent Anthony Godfrey stopped by a few classrooms to get an idea from students themselves on how the new school year is shaping up. The students talked about classes they enjoy, teachers they like and how much they love lunch and recess. Some of them talked about what they want to be when they grow up – with aspirations to be everything from veterinarians, to movie stars, video game designers, scientists, business owners and more.

The Superintendent left Terra Linda knowing students are in good hands with great teachers, an amazing principal and a kind and caring staff.
#jordanschooldistrict #jordandistrict #uted #utpol West Jordan City Hall

post_text:
Foothills Elementary Shows Kindness is Not Just a Superpower

Foothills Elementary launched their school theme of "Be Kind, Be Your Own Superhero" during their welcome back assembly for the new school year. Principal Cherie Wilson and assistant principal Leslie Ewell donned superhero costumes to show students that compassion and strength are something that everyone possesses inside of themselves. Also unveiled at the assembly was a new mural that exemplifies the school's theme of kindness.

Great job Foothills Elementary students for showing us how kindness is a mighty strength.

#JordanDistrict #JordanSchoolDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation

post_text:
Students Benefit from School Buses Packed with Tools for Schools

It was a labor of love as local school districts, Country Hit Station Z104, Utah Board of Realtors and the community joined forces to fill school buses with supplies for students in need. Everyone rallied together in a project called “Tools for Schools.”

Jordan School District was once again proud to be part of this community effort, which provides food, clothing, hygiene kits, school supplies and backpacks for students who might otherwise go without the things they need for a successful start to the new school year.

Thank you to everyone who participated and to members of the community for taking care of kids!
#jordanschooldistrict #jordandistrict #uted #utpol

post_text:
DARE Officers Head to Class At Fox Hollow Preparing for Their Own Graduation

It was a fun day for students at Fox Hollow Elementary School as they had the opportunity to get to know some DARE officers from around the country as well as several from West Jordan, Herriman and Riverton. The officers were at Fox Hollow as part of their own training and requirements to graduate and teach DARE in schools all over the United States. About 15 officers were observed while teaching a DARE lesson in classrooms at Fox Hollow. After the lessons were done, it was time to have some fun. The officers took time to interact with students in the gym playing basketball while others visited kindergarten classes where they engaged with students with a video workout.

It was a day of positive interactions with police officers that Fox Hollow students won’t soon forget.
#jordandistrict #jordanschooldistrict #uted #utpol

The 60-year-old West Jordan Middle School was taken down in a carefully planned demolition that is nearing completion. Now, the brand new WJMS is open and home to 1,157 students who are starting an exciting 2019-20 school year.

While the old school is gone, years of wonderful memories will live on for students who graced the halls generation after generation.

Here is a TIME LAPSE VIDEO of the old West Jordan Middle coming down.

post_text:
Rolling Out the Red Carpet to Welcome the 2019-20 School Year

Welcome students, teachers and staff to the 2019-20 school year! We hope it is off to a great start for everyone.

At the brand new Ridge View Elementary School in Herriman and Mountain Point Elementary in Bluffdale students walked the red carpet heading into classrooms for the very first time inside their new buildings. A total of five new schools are now open for the 2019-20 school year in Jordan School District.

Thanks to everyone who worked so hard to get the new schools up and running.

Here’s to a safe, successful and fun school year filled with memories to last a lifetime.

#JordanDistrict #JordanSchoolDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation

post_text:
A Warm Welcome To JSD 7th Grade Students

It was an exciting morning at our middle schools as 7th grade orientation had students walking the halls, meeting teachers and trying their hand at lockers figuring out combinations and doing some fancy locker decorating. One student’s locker has a disco ball, with decorative lights, picture frames ready to be filled and a fur rug.

At the new West Jordan Middle School, they are ready for a new beginning with bright hallways and welcoming classrooms. Principal Dixie Garrison even began the year with KSL TV interview.

At Oquirrh Hills Middle Principal Donna Hunter took selfies with a sign that said “The first day of school and already my principal likes me.”

Have a safe and successful 2019-20 school year filled with memories you will never forget!

post_text:
FUN FACT FRIDAY: Five New Schools Set to Open On Time and Under Budget in Jordan School District as 2019-20 School Year Begins

It has been a race to the finish as crews work to put the finishing touches on five new schools opening in Jordan School District for the 2019-20 school year. Having all the new schools ready to open and welcome students for the first day of school has been a huge undertaking. However, thanks to hard working staff, construction crews and principals who have spent countless hours making sure everything is ready – the doors to all five new schools will open on time and under budget.

The first new school to open is Mountain Ridge High School (Herriman) on Monday, August 19 at 7:30 a.m. This school is opening one year early.

On Tuesday, August 20, Mountain Point (Bluffdale) and Ridge View Elementary Schools (Herriman) open along with Mountain Creek Middle School (South Jordan) and the rebuild of West Jordan Middle School.

#jordanschooldistrict #jordandistrict #uted #utpol Herriman City City of South Jordan West Jordan City Hall Bluffdale City, Utah

post_text:
Ribbon Cutting Marks Opening of Mountain Creek Middle School

With an oversized pair of scissors, red ribbon and smiles all around from students, teachers, administrators, board members and city officials, it was time to mark the opening of the new Mountain Creek Middle School in South Jordan. Principal Mike Glenn and Assistant Principals Tim Brooks and Wendy Harmon did the honors – cutting the ribbon before a cheering crowd. Board President Bryce Dunford and South Jordan City Mayor Dawn Ramsey shared their excitement addressing the crowd that gathered.

Then, it was time for Back to School night at Mountain Creek Middle. We hope the 2019-20 school year is safe, successful and one made of memories that will last a lifetime!
#jordandistrict #jordanschooldistrict #uted #utpol City of South Jordan

post_text:
State Superintendent of Public Instruction Joins in Tour of New Mountain Ridge High School

If you walk into the brand new Mountain Ridge High School, you will see a flurry of activity right now. Students and parents are preparing for the first day with tours, registration and some are already involved in athletics.

On Wednesday, State Superintendent of Public Instruction Sydnee Dickson joined Jordan School District Board of Education members, Superintendent Anthony Godfrey and others on a guided tour of the new school. Already there is a feeling of Sentinel pride throughout the building and Principal Mike Kochevar says students are embracing the idea of being ‘Sentinel Strong.’

The public is invited to an open house Friday, August 16, from 3:30-6:30 followed by the schools’ first home football game, which starts at 7 p.m.

Here is a video tour of Mountain Ridge High thanks to drone pilot, Aaron Baker.
#jordanschooldistrict #jordandistrict #uted #utpol Herriman City

post_text:
Mountain Point Elementary Prepares to Open with Some Help from Boy Scouts

It is a race to the finish at Mountain Point Elementary School as they prepare to welcome hundreds of students to the new school in Bluffdale on Tuesday. Principal Carolyn Bona is ready and thankful for the opportunity to share brand new opportunities the school will bring to students, teachers and staff.

This week Mountain Point is getting a little help from Boy Scout Troop 1466 from Riverton. They showed up at the school with service in mind, participating in an Eagle Scout Project. The project goal was to assembly all the school’s gym equipment including soccer goals, ball carts, inflating soccer and basketballs and more. Thanks to the young Scouts and their leader, Aaron Baker, for playing a part in getting the school ready for a smooth and successful first year.

Best of luck on your 2019-20 school year Mountain Point Elementary School!
#jordandistrict #jordanschooldistrict #uted #utpol

post_text:
Thousands of Jordan School District Educators Come Together to Kick Off The New School Year With Inspirational Professional Development Day

It was a special day for educators in Jordan School District as 3,500 of them came together for a powerful Professional Development Day designed to inspire, energize and get everyone excited about possibilities for the new school year.

Superintendent Anthony Godfrey welcomed everyone encouraging them to be curious, intentional and present. Board of Education President Bryce Dunford also spoke, saying it is teachers who will change the course of history.

Keynote speakers Timothy Kanold and Dave Burgess shared messages telling educators they are the heart of education and in the life-changing business. They encouraged teachers to immerse themselves in what they do and continue to be hero’s each and every day.

Thank you to our amazing educators! Have a successful and rewarding school year!

#jordandistrict #jordanschooldistrict #uted #utpol

FUN FACT FRIDAY: Community Invited to Attend Open House and Official Opening of the Road to Mountain Ridge High School

Mountain Ridge High School is almost ready to open its doors to students, teachers and staff who will create lasting memories in academics, athletics and a wide variety of extracurricular activities at the new school.

On Friday, August 16 memories will be made as the community comes together to officially open the road that leads to Mountain Ridge High – Sentinel Ridge Blvd. Everyone is invited to a ribbon cutting ceremony that starts at 2:30 p.m.

Then the public is invited to get a first look inside Mountain Ridge by attending an open house from 3:30 – 6:30 p.m.

Finally, the Mountain Ridge High Sentinels play their very first football game at home against Olympus High at 7 p.m. on Friday, August 16.

Join us as we cheer on the Sentinels!

post_text:
JSD Principals and Other Administrators Join Forces to Fill School Food Pantries, Backpacks and Hygiene Kits for Students in Need

It was a big labor of love for more than 200 principals and administrators in Jordan School District as they joined forces to help students in need this coming school year. The principals worked together to pack 800 weekend food kits so students don’t go hungry, 800 hygiene kits for students and 800 school supply backpacks for elementary students who might otherwise go without.

The massive service project was made possible thanks to a generous $20,832.45 donation from Walmart to the Jordan Education Foundation. Wal-Mart provided all the food, hygiene supplies and school supplies to fill 2,400 Kits for Kids!

Thank you to Walmart and all of our caring principals and administrators for helping JSD take care of kids.
#jordanschooldistrict #jordandistrict #uted #utpol

post_text:
Students Show off Their Leadership Skills at National Conference

Three teams from Herriman High School placed in the 'Future Business Leaders of American National Leadership Conference' in San Antonio, Texas. Thomas Packham and Kirsten Kersiek placed 6th in LifeSmarts competition, Ashton Blanchard for 9th place in Coding and Programming, and Kadin Adam, Kyler Evans, and Isaac Ancell for 10th place in Mobile Application Development. A total of 24 students attended the conference from Herriman.

While in San Antonio, the students also participated in a service project. They boxed over 11,000 pounds of food for 9000 meals, to feed those in need in the San Antonio area.

Great job to all the students on your accomplishments you made us all very proud. Keep up the hard work.

#JordandSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation Herriman City

post_text:
JATC South Instructor a Semifinalist for National Excellence in Teaching Award

Blair Jensen, a Welding and Agriculture Mechanics Instructor with JATC South, has been recognized as a semifinalist in the 'Harbor Freight Tools for School Prize for Teaching Excellence.' He is one of 50 educators in the nation to receive the honor and will move on to the next round of the competition where first and second place winners are picked. The awards program was established to help promote education for students wanting to learn skill trades at the high school level. The top three first-place winners and their schools will each receive a $100,000 prize with $70,000 going to the school. Fifteen second-place winners will each be awarded $50,000, with $35,000 going to the school.

Congratulations Blair for a well-deserved award and good luck on the future competition. We will be rooting for you!

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation
Utah CTE - Career and Technical Education

post_text:
Jordan Education Foundation and WalMart Team Up to Help Students in Jordan School District

Jordan Educations Foundation received a grant from WalMart to purchase supplies for 2400 take-home food packs, hygiene kits, and backpacks to hand out this school year. The backpacks and kits will be filled with essential supplies by Jordan School District Administrators and handed out to struggling families within the District. Employees from local WalMart stores also donated their time to set up and deliver the supplies.

A big thank you, to WalMart and their local employees who donated valuable time to make sure all JSD students have a happy and healthy school year.

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #UtahEducation #utpol

Jordan Educations Foundation received a grant from WalMart to purchase supplies for 2400 take-home food packs, hygiene kits, and backpacks to hand out this school year. The backpacks and kits will be filled with essential supplies by Jordan School District Administrators and handed out to struggling families within the District. Employees from local WalMart stores also donated their time to set up and deliver the supplies.

A big thank you, to WalMart and their local employees who donated valuable time to make sure all JSD students have a happy and healthy school year.

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #UtahEducation #utpol

post_text:
For generations of student’s, middle school memories will live on from countless hours spent in the classrooms and hallways of West Jordan Middle School. But after more than 60 years, the oldest school in Jordan School District is being torn down as the new West Jordan Middle School prepares to open on the same property. This week demolition crews began work to bring the old school down, something that will take more than a week. This is a rare event because our schools are built to last for 60 to 70 years. West Jordan Middle has served students and the community well.

The new school, built directly behind the old school, will open in August for the 2019-20 school year.

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation West Jordan City Hall

post_text:
Crews Hard at Work As New Schools Get Ready to Open

It is a race to the finish line as five new schools get set to open for the 2019-20 school year in Jordan School District.

For example, two schools are under construction in Bluffdale. Mountain Point Elementary is nearly finished, ready to welcome students, teachers and staff in the upcoming school year.

Significant progress has been made on Hidden Valley Middle School in Bluffdale, it will open in the 2020-21 school year.

Enjoy these images of progress on our new schools in Bluffdale.

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation Bluffdale City, Utah

post_text:
West Jordan High School wanted something big, bright and bold to welcome students, teachers, staff and others to the Jaguar Jungle as they enter the school in the coming year. So, the school commissioned art teacher Robyn Briggs to paint a mural on a 15 x 20 foot wall in the main entrance of WJHS. The mural took Robyn, with the help of her husband, about four days to complete and the result is a welcome like no other. The finished mural is a sign of Jaguar pride and strength.

Great job, Robyn! Thank you for sharing your amazing talent.

Enjoy this time-lapse of the project from start to finish.

#JordanDistrict #JordanSchoolDistrict #Utah #UtahEducatioin #utpol West Jordan City Hall

post_text:
Dear Outstanding Employees, Patrons and Board Members of Jordan School District,

It has been an honor and a privilege to serve as your Superintendent. I have learned much from you over the past eight years and will take those lessons learned and implement them into my life as I interact with the lives of others.

Thank you for the incredible impact you all have had on my life with your great passion for and advocacy of public education. I am grateful for your genuine hearts and incredible desires to provide the very best education possible for the young people of Jordan School District.

I am excited to watch and cheer as Superintendent Godfrey launches JSD into its next chapter of greatness! Enjoy the incredible journey and continue to reach for excellence as you strive to serve Every Child, Every Day!

With gratitude and great appreciation,
Patrice A. Johnson, Ed. D.
Superintendent
Jordan School District

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #UtahEducation

post_text:
Bonnie Crockett, a teacher at South Jordan Elementary School, has a passion for teaching kids to play musical instruments. For several years she has been teaching kids how to play ukeleles and harmonicas in after-school music clubs. This year, Ms. Crocketts was awarded a grant from the Jordan School District Board of Education for her hard work in helping students develop a passion for music. Ms. Crockett says she sees how these clubs help kids build a love for learning and helps them form bonds with other students.

Thanks, Ms. Crockett, for sharing your passion in time with the students at South Jordan Elementary.

post_text:
Foothills Elementary School 4th-Graders Take The Stage to Celebrate Utah History

Foothills Elementary School's annual play celebrating Utah history was performed with a twist this year to honor the 150th anniversary of the completion of the 'Trans-Continental Rail Road' in the Utah desert. Jodi White, the 'Beverley Taylor Sorenson' Drama Specialist for the school, modified their regular program to spotlight the accomplishments surrounding the 'Golden Spike Event.' She said students have been working on the play since April, with students practicing daily for the last three weeks.

Great job students and staff at Foothills Elementary for an amazing performance!

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #utpol

post_text:
Congratulations Jordan School District Teacher of the Year!

Please join us in congratulating Blackridge Elementary School’s Rachelle Smith who is the 2019 Jordan School District Teacher of the Year.

Ms. Smith is a first-grade teacher who has been an educator in the District for 11 years. Colleagues describe her as an unbelievable talent and a teacher who is brilliant with technology.

Principal Steve Giles says Ms. Smith is innovative, dynamic, students adore her and learning outcomes in her classroom are amazing.

Ms. Smith will now represent Jordan School District in the competition for Utah Teacher of the Year.

Thank you, Rachelle Smith, for your incredible work in education and for making JSD proud!

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation Herriman City

post_text:
Drone pilot Aaron Baker is volunteering his time and talents to help Jordan School District document construction and completion of our new schools. Aaron’s most recent drone flight gives us a bird's-eye view of construction that has begun on the new elementary school in west, West Jordan.

The foundation is partially complete with masonry walls going up in the gym and cafeteria area. The school is the Bastian and Golden Fields Elementary model and is set to open in the 2020-21 school year.

Enjoy this sneak peek of the new school thanks to Aaron Baker.

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #UtahEducation #utpol
West Jordan City Hall

post_text:
Foothills Elementary Students Cut Their Locks for Love

Short hair is trendy at Foothills Elementary School after seven students donated their long locks to 'Locks of Love.' The first through sixth-graders all had big smiles on their faces as stylists from Taylor Andrews Hair Academy cut off the donations during a schoolwide assembly. 'Locks of Love's' mission is to return a sense of self, confidence and normalcy to children suffering from hair loss by utilizing donated ponytails to provide the highest quality hair prosthetics to financially disadvantaged children free of charge.

These students are a great example of generosity in our schools. Keep up the great work!

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #UtahEducation #utpol #LocksofLove Riverton City Government

post_text:
Partnership Makes Important Safety Training Possible

It was a two-day hands-on and information training made possible by a partnership with West Jordan City Police and the Utah Highway Patrol. The agencies came together with District safety and Emergency Operations personnel to conduct training for all JSD Transportation employees from bus drivers and support staff to mechanics. The training helped prepare everyone for challenging situations that may occur on a school bus and helped teach employees how best to handle those situations with the goal of a safe outcome for students and everyone involved.

Thank you to West Jordan Police, SWAT and members of the Utah Highway Patrol for helping to keep students, drivers, staff, parents and volunteers safe on our school buses.

#JordanDistrict #JordanSchoolDistrict #Utah #utpol #UtahEducation West Jordan City Hall West Jordan Police Department Utah Highway Patrol

post_text:
FUN FACT FRIDAY: Class of 2019 Awarded Millions in Scholarships

Students in the graduating class of 2019 are embarking on a new chapter in their young lives. Many are headed to colleges, universities and community colleges in Utah and across the United States. This year many of those graduates are also getting a little help along the way in the form of scholarships.

District-wide the class of 2019 was awarded a total of $30,222,126 in scholarships.

Thanks to our dedicated counselors and school leaders who helped students apply for and earn the scholarship money.

Congratulations graduates! Good luck in all your pursuits!

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #UtahEducaton #utpo #Graduation2019

post_text:
'Summer History Academy' Helps Teachers Bring Social Studies to Life

Jordan School District fifth and sixth-grade teachers participated in a day of workshops and activities during the 'Summer History Academy' at South Jordan Middle School. The 24 educators spent a week digging into the core curriculum, hands-on social studies lessons and new techniques for teaching current events. The academy is a way for teachers to learn from each other and bring new ideas into their classrooms.

The week ended with teachers ready and eager to use their new resources with their students in the fall!

#JordanSchoolDistrict #JordanDistrict #Utah #UtahEducation #utpol #Summer
